conclusion: Need to find the turns ratio of the primary and secondary coils in a transformer circuit.
Primary coil has an ammeter reading 1.4 A; secondary side has three 50 Ω resistors and a voltmeter reading 10 V.
The transformer is ideal, meaning no losses, and turns ratio affects voltage and current ratios.
Secondary coil is connected to R1, then splits to R2 and R3, which are in parallel.
R1 is in series with the parallel combination of R2 and R3.
Equivalent resistance on the secondary side is calculated as 75 Ω.
Voltage across R3 is 10 V, current through R3 is 0.2 A.
Voltage across R2 is 10 V, current through R2 is 0.2 A.
Current through R1 is the sum of currents through R2 and R3, totaling 0.4 A.
Secondary current I1 is 0.4 A, primary current is 1.4 A.
Turns ratio n2/n1 is calculated as 3.5, leading to n1/n2 ≈ 0.2857.
